result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:01 AM 
Defendant Christopher Owens in court. Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Christopher Owens. Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 21CF432, 22CF59, and 22CF317.
ADA Dodge states appearances.
Atty Kryshak makes argument for bond modification and notes that the defendant has a place to stay and a job opportunity.
Court questions the defendant.
ADA Dodge makes argument in opposition to modification of bond.
Court questions Atty Kryshak in regards to the current bond.

BY THE COURT:
Bond modified.
In 22CF317:
$500 cash bond.
Follow all bond conditions in other cases.
Participate in Portage County Day Report and Comply with all requirements for assessment.
Defendant must live at the address as noted in court.
Status Conference set for 09/19/22 - attempted, not known
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

filed by Atty Gary Kryshak

matter scheduled for ptc 5/23/22 at 10:00
Order Granting Motion to Withdraw /s/ TTF 04/18/22
Order Granting Motion to Withdraw filed by Atty Paul Zilles (sent to TTF on 04/19/22 sp)
filed by Atty Paul Zilles (sent to TTF on 04/18/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:25 PM Defendant Christopher Owens appeared in court, Attorney Paul Edward Zilles for Christopher Owens appeared in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.

3:26 p.m.  Deputy C Stanton is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Pfeil.
3:28 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
3:31 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Zilles.
3:34 p.m.  ADA Pfeil has no redirect and no further witnesses.
Witness is excused.
ADA Pfeil would ask that the court take judicial notice of 21CF432.
Court reviews the bond for 21CF432.
Atty Zilles has no objection to the Court taking judicial notice of 21CF432 and its bond conditions.
Aty Zilles does not wish to present any testimony.
Neither party has any final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Owens
Current: 3419 Mission Ln, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2022)
Prior: 2901 Soo Marie Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481

03:20 PM Defendant Christopher Owens appeared by video. Prosecuting District Attorney (DA) Louis Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin.
This case was rescheduled as the Defendant's attorney was not available today.  Dedendant requests a signature bond.  Court questions DA Molepske.
Court will not amend the bond today as this is a branch 2 case.
Defendant to talk to his attorney.
  BY THE COURT:  Motion to amend denied.
Filed by the State:  Prelim set for 3/14/22 @ 3:00 in Br 1
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:16 PM Defendant Christopher Owens appeared by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney (Atty) Paul Edward Zilles appeared in person. Defendant Christopher Owens in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defndant has not yet received a copy of the complaint.
Atty Zilles would like to recall so that he can go over to the jail.
Defendant makes a statements with regards to bond.
Motions to change bond need to go to the Circuit Court Judge.

Attorney received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Defendant did not receive a copy of the complaint; but wishes to proceed as long as his attorney files a motion to amend his bond conditions.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Preliminary Hearing to be held within time limits.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Bond modification to be filed with the Circuit Court Judge.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Atty Paul Zilles appointed
Initial Appearance set for February 14, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
No contact with co-defendant: Savannah Mohrland.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge  appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty)  Max Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

22GF51 and 22GF52 are co-defendants, same probable cause in both cases. 

1:44PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of possession with intent to deliver and possession of meth and possession of drug paraphernalia and bailjumping. Facts are the same as in 22GF52.
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court finds Court has jurisdiction.
Court recites facts, for the record.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Public defender's office will appoint someone for Defendant, will probably be same attorney as in current case.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner addresses the Court regarding bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: February 14, 2022   @ 1:15  p.m.  in Branch 2
